Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different types of habitats, such as land and water environments (e.g., playground, garden, pond, stream).
The student can illustrate a variety of living things within each habitat, including plants (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes) and animals (e.g., lizards, squirrels, fish).
The student can compare and show the diversity of living things by drawing different plants and animals found in each habitat.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate patterns in where different plants and animals live, showing that certain living things are found in specific habitats.
